definitions.definition: to move your head or the top half of your body forwards and downwards as a sign of respect or to say hello or goodbye

examples.text: He bowed low to the assembled crowd.
The people all bowed down before the emperor.
He swept off his hat and bowed deeply to the queen.
The emperor's subjects bowed down before him.
The pianist stood up and bowed to the audience.

definitions.definition: to move your head forwards and downwards

examples.text: She bowed her head in shame.
They stood in silence with their heads bowed.

definitions.definition: to bend or make something bend

examples.text: The pines bowed in the wind.
Their backs were bowed under the weight of their packs.

definitions.definition: to be too polite to an important person in order to gain their approval

examples.text: She was beginning to tire of all their bowing and scraping.

wordOrigin: Old English būgan ‘bend, stoop’, of Germanic origin; related to German biegen, also to bow2. Bow of a boat/​ship is late Middle English: from Low German boog, Dutch boeg, ‘shoulder or ship's bow’; related to bough.
